description: Oksana Lintz and Rada Miskovic release Halden’s full confession and decrypted narrative logs citywide, revealing BCI’s intentional design to fail and urging citizens to reclaim governance.
Intense citywide debates erupt as citizens confront the truth of Halden’s revelations; scrutiny falls on BCI policies and every decision made by the former Council.
Facing overwhelming public pressure and loss of legitimacy, the remaining Council members announce their resignation. BCI controls are abandoned.
Ad hoc citizens’ gatherings and forums establish open committees to review and publicly audit former BCI processes, replacing hidden governance with transparent collective oversight.
A citywide assembly formalizes the dissolution of all BCI scoring and protocols. Citizens void scores and draft new guidelines for open, participatory governance.
